intro: Eurybia iodochroa, commonly known as frostweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in moist, woodland environments and is often found in shaded areas. Its scientific name reflects its affinity for coastal and wetland habitats. Eurybia iodochroa is also notable for its role in supporting local pollinators and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
